intro: Stylidium hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features a distinctive trigger mechanism in its flowers, which helps in pollination by attracting insects. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Stylidium hirsutum is part of the family Haemodoraceae, known for its unique floral structures and adaptations to arid environments.
